# Skywalker family

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

"Skywalker" redirects here. For other uses, see [Skywalker
(disambiguation)](/wiki/Skywalker_\(disambiguation\) "Skywalker
\(disambiguation\)").

![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/40px-Ambox_important.svg.png) |  This Star Wars-related article **describes a work or element of fiction in a primarily[in-universe](/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Writing_about_fiction "Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Writing about fiction") style**. Please [help rewrite it](//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit) to [explain the fiction more clearly and provide non-fictional perspective](/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Writing_about_fiction "Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Writing about fiction"). _(February 2008)_ _([Learn how and when to remove this template message](/wiki/Help:Maintenance_template_removal "Help:Maintenance template removal"))_

The **Skywalker family** is a fictional family in the _[Star
Wars](/wiki/Star_Wars "Star Wars")_ franchise. Within the series' [fictional
universe](/wiki/Fictional_universe "Fictional universe"), the Skywalkers are a
bloodline with strong inherent capabilities related to [the
Force](/wiki/Force_\(Star_Wars\) "Force \(Star Wars\)"). [Luke
Skywalker](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker "Luke Skywalker"), his twin sister [Princess
Leia](/wiki/Princess_Leia "Princess Leia"), and their father [Darth
Vader](/wiki/Darth_Vader "Darth Vader") are central characters in the
[original _Star Wars_ film trilogy](/wiki/Star_Wars_original_trilogy "Star
Wars original trilogy"). Vader, in his previous identity as Anakin Skywalker,
is a lead character in the [prequel film
trilogy](/wiki/Star_Wars_prequel_trilogy "Star Wars prequel trilogy"). Luke,
Leia, and Leia's son [Kylo Ren](/wiki/Kylo_Ren "Kylo Ren") play crucial roles
in the [sequel trilogy](/wiki/Star_Wars_sequel_trilogy "Star Wars sequel
trilogy") of films.

## History[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: History")]

In terms of the series' internal chronology, the Skywalkers first appeared in
the 1999 film _[Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom
Menace](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_I_%E2%80%93_The_Phantom_Menace "Star Wars:
Episode I – The Phantom Menace")_. In this film, [Jedi Knight](/wiki/Jedi
"Jedi") [Qui-Gon Jinn](/wiki/Qui-Gon_Jinn "Qui-Gon Jinn") discovers [Shmi
Skywalker](/wiki/Shmi_Skywalker "Shmi Skywalker") and her son Anakin as slaves
on the planet [Tatooine](/wiki/Tatooine "Tatooine"). Qui-Gon finds that Anakin
has a higher count of [midi-chlorians](/wiki/Midi-chlorians "Midi-chlorians")
(force-imparting microorganisms) than any Jedi, even [Yoda](/wiki/Yoda
"Yoda"), counting to about 20,000. Shmi informs Qui-Gon that Anakin has no
father, leading Qui-Gon to suggest that Anakin is a product of midi-chlorians,
an example of a [miraculous birth](/wiki/Miraculous_birth "Miraculous birth").
As the film progresses, Anakin leaves Tatooine to begin his Jedi training.

_[Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the
Clones](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_II_%E2%80%93_Attack_of_the_Clones "Star Wars:
Episode II – Attack of the Clones")_ reveals that, in Anakin's absence, Shmi
has married [Cliegg Lars](/wiki/List_of_Star_Wars_characters#L "List of Star
Wars characters"), becoming the stepmother of
[Owen](/wiki/List_of_Star_Wars_characters#L "List of Star Wars characters").
Owen tells Anakin they are stepbrothers. Owen later marries [Beru
Whitesun](/wiki/List_of_Star_Wars_characters#L "List of Star Wars
characters"). As a Jedi Knight, Anakin secretly marries [Padmé
Amidala](/wiki/Padm%C3%A9_Amidala "Padmé Amidala").

In _[Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the
Sith](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_III_%E2%80%93_Revenge_of_the_Sith "Star Wars:
Episode III – Revenge of the Sith")_ Padme gives birth to twins,
[Luke](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker "Luke Skywalker") and [Leia](/wiki/Princess_Leia
"Princess Leia"). Luke is raised by Beru and Owen Lars on Tatooine. While Leia
is raised by Senator [Bail Organa](/wiki/Bail_Organa "Bail Organa") and Queen
[Breha Organa](/wiki/Breha_Organa "Breha Organa") on
[Alderaan](/wiki/Alderaan_\(Star_Wars\) "Alderaan \(Star Wars\)").

In _[Star Wars: The Force Awakens](/wiki/Star_Wars:_The_Force_Awakens "Star
Wars: The Force Awakens")_ , Leia and her husband [Han Solo](/wiki/Han_Solo
"Han Solo"), after marrying have a son named [Ben Solo](/wiki/Kylo_Ren "Kylo
Ren"), who later adopts the name Kylo Ren. The family breaks apart following
Ben's descent into the dark side, with Leia and Han separating.

## Family
members[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=2 "Edit
section: Family members")]

### Shmi Skywalker-
Lars[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=3 "Edit
section: Shmi Skywalker-Lars")]

Shmi Skywalker is a [fictional character](/wiki/Fictional_character "Fictional
character") in the _Star Wars_ [universe](/wiki/Fictional_universe "Fictional
universe"), portrayed by [Pernilla August](/wiki/Pernilla_August "Pernilla
August"). She appears in _[Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom
Menace](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_I_%E2%80%93_The_Phantom_Menace "Star Wars:
Episode I – The Phantom Menace")_ and _[Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the
Clones](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_II_%E2%80%93_Attack_of_the_Clones "Star Wars:
Episode II – Attack of the Clones")_. She is the mother of [Anakin
Skywalker](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker "Anakin Skywalker"), paternal grandmother to
[Luke Skywalker](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker "Luke Skywalker") and [Leia
Organa](/wiki/Princess_Leia "Princess Leia") and paternal-maternal great-
grandmother to [Kylo Ren](/wiki/Kylo_Ren "Kylo Ren"). Her first name is
derived from [Lakshmi](/wiki/Lakshmi "Lakshmi"), a [Hindu](/wiki/Hindu
"Hindu") [goddess](/wiki/Goddess "Goddess").

In _The Phantom Menace_ , she and her son are introduced as
[slaves](/wiki/Slavery "Slavery") of junk merchant [Watto](/wiki/Watto
"Watto") on the desert world [Tatooine](/wiki/Tatooine "Tatooine").[1] She
welcomes [Jedi Master](/wiki/Jedi "Jedi") [Qui-Gon Jinn](/wiki/Qui-Gon_Jinn
"Qui-Gon Jinn") ([Liam Neeson](/wiki/Liam_Neeson "Liam Neeson")) into their
home, and tells him that Anakin has no father; she simply
"[became](/wiki/Parthenogenesis "Parthenogenesis")"
[pregnant](/wiki/Miraculous_birth "Miraculous birth") with him. Qui-Gon helps
Anakin win his freedom, but cannot get Shmi out of slavery. She allows Anakin
to leave with Qui-Gon, assuring her heartbroken son that they will meet again.

In _Attack of the Clones_ , Anakin ([Hayden
Christensen](/wiki/Hayden_Christensen "Hayden Christensen")), now a young
adult [Jedi](/wiki/Jedi "Jedi") apprentice, senses through the
[Force](/wiki/Force_\(Star_Wars\) "Force \(Star Wars\)") that she is in pain.
He travels to Tatooine to find her, and, upon arriving, learns that she had
been freed by and married to moisture farmer [Cliegg
Lars](/wiki/Minor_residents_of_Tatooine#Lars,_Cliegg "Minor residents of
Tatooine") ([Jack Thompson](/wiki/Jack_Thompson_\(actor\) "Jack Thompson
\(actor\)")), but had recently been abducted by [Tusken
Raiders](/wiki/Tusken_Raiders "Tusken Raiders"). He finds her inside one of
their encampments, but it's too late—beaten and [tortured](/wiki/Torture
"Torture") beyond help, she dies in his arms. Heartbroken and enraged, Anakin
slaughters every single Tusken in the camp, including the women and children.
His mother's death ignites a strong anger in Anakin, and sets him on the path
to becoming [Darth Vader](/wiki/Darth_Vader "Darth Vader").

### Anakin Skywalker (Darth
Vader)[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=4 "Edit
section: Anakin Skywalker \(Darth Vader\)")]

Main article: [Darth Vader](/wiki/Darth_Vader "Darth Vader")

Anakin Skywalker is the son of Shmi Skywalker and no father, due to being
conceived through the force. Anakin is discovered on [Tatooine](/wiki/Tatooine
"Tatooine") by Jedi Master [Qui-Gon Jinn](/wiki/Qui-Gon_Jinn "Qui-Gon Jinn")
who is sure that the boy is the "Chosen One" of Jedi Prophecy, who will bring
balance to the Force. After the death of Qui-Gon, he becomes the
[Padawan](/wiki/Jedi#Padawan "Jedi") of Obi-Wan Kenobi. He also forms a close
bond with [Padmé Amidala](/wiki/Padm%C3%A9_Amidala "Padmé Amidala"), the young
senator of [Naboo](/wiki/Naboo "Naboo"). The newly elected Chancellor of the
Galactic Republic, Palpatine, also befriends Anakin, promising to watch the
boy's progress "with great interest" and advise him. Torn between his loyalty
to the Jedi and his drive for power, Anakin succumbs to temptation and becomes
Darth Vader.

### Padmé
Amidala[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=5 "Edit
section: Padmé Amidala")]

Main article: [Padmé Amidala](/wiki/Padm%C3%A9_Amidala "Padmé Amidala")

The secret wife of Anakin Skywalker, and mother of Luke and Leia and maternal
grandmother of Kylo Ren. She served as Queen of Naboo, and later as a Senator
for her planet. Her closest friend in the Senate was Senator Bail Organa. She
reconnected and fell in love with Anakin Skywalker after he was assigned to
protect her from an assassination attempt, and secretly married him shortly
after the Battle of Geonosis, and died while giving birth to her children
shortly after the first Empire Day. Obi-Wan and Yoda decided to separate the
children in order to keep them hidden from Darth Vader.

### Luke
Skywalker[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Luke Skywalker")]

Main article: [Luke Skywalker](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker "Luke Skywalker")

Luke Skywalker is the son of Jedi Knight [Anakin
Skywalker](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker "Anakin Skywalker") and Senator of Naboo,
[Padmé Amidala](/wiki/Padm%C3%A9_Amidala "Padmé Amidala"). He is taken in by
his uncle and aunt, Owen and Beru Lars, after the death of Padmé and Anakin's
fall to the dark side. He is force sensitive and skilled with a lightsaber. In
_Return of the Jedi_ , a dying Yoda confirms to Luke, that Darth Vader
(previously Anakin Skywalker) is actually his father, despite Luke's belief
that Vader's claim to fatherhood in _The Empire Strikes Back_ was a ruse to
pull Luke to the dark side. He also finds out from Obi-Wan's [force
ghost](/wiki/Force_ghost "Force ghost") that Princess Leia Organa is his
sister. In _The Force Awakens_ , as the last known Jedi, Luke is in hiding
after failing to prevent his nephew Ben (now Kylo Ren) from turning to the
dark side to join [Supreme Leader Snoke](/wiki/Supreme_Leader_Snoke "Supreme
Leader Snoke").

### Leia
Organa[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=7 "Edit
section: Leia Organa")]

Main article: [Princess Leia](/wiki/Princess_Leia "Princess Leia")

The daughter of [Anakin Skywalker](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker "Anakin Skywalker")
and [Padmé Amidala](/wiki/Padm%C3%A9_Amidala "Padmé Amidala"), [Leia
Organa](/wiki/Princess_Leia "Princess Leia") was adopted by Bail and Breha
Organa of Alderaan. At age 19 she is the Princess of Alderaan, and is captured
by Darth Vader while in the [Tantive IV](/wiki/Tantive_IV "Tantive IV")
[blockade runner](/wiki/Blockade_runner "Blockade runner") on a so-called
"diplomatic mission". Leia is shown to be force sensitive. In _[The Empire
Strikes Back](/wiki/The_Empire_Strikes_Back "The Empire Strikes Back")_ , Leia
professes her love for [Han Solo](/wiki/Han_Solo "Han Solo") when he is put
into carbonite stasis, although it is originally Han and Luke who compete for
her affections. In _[Return of the Jedi](/wiki/Return_of_the_Jedi "Return of
the Jedi")_ , planning to feed Luke, Han, and [Chewbacca](/wiki/Chewbacca
"Chewbacca") to the flesh eating [Sarlacc](/wiki/Sarlacc "Sarlacc"), [Jabba
the Hutt](/wiki/Jabba_the_Hutt "Jabba the Hutt") is instead strangled to death
by Leia by a chain he has on her. She later becomes involved in the Battle of
Endor. In the years that follow, she becomes General Organa, the leader of the
Resistance, a military organization unofficially backed by the New Republic to
counter the First Order. She married Han Solo and had a son named [Ben
Solo](/wiki/Ben_Solo "Ben Solo"), later Kylo Ren, whose turning to the dark
side separated the couple before the events of _The Force Awakens_. Leia has
been on a search to find her missing brother Luke[2] and save her son from the
dark side.

### Ben Solo (Kylo
Ren)[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=8 "Edit
section: Ben Solo \(Kylo Ren\)")]

Main article: [Kylo Ren](/wiki/Kylo_Ren "Kylo Ren")

Ben Solo[3] is the son of [Leia Organa](/wiki/Princess_Leia "Princess Leia")
and [Han Solo](/wiki/Han_Solo "Han Solo"). He initially trains to be a Jedi
under his uncle, [Luke Skywalker](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker "Luke Skywalker"),
before he falls to the dark side and becomes Kylo Ren, working for the First
Order and under the influence of [Supreme Leader
Snoke](/wiki/Supreme_Leader_Snoke "Supreme Leader Snoke"). He is obsessed with
the legacy of his grandfather, the Sith Lord Darth Vader, and aspires to
finish what Vader started: the elimination of the Jedi.

## _Legends_[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=10
"Edit section: Legends")]

With the 2012 acquisition of [Lucasfilm](/wiki/Lucasfilm "Lucasfilm") by [The
Walt Disney Company](/wiki/The_Walt_Disney_Company "The Walt Disney Company"),
most of the licensed _Star Wars_ novels and comics produced since the
originating 1977 film _[Star Wars](/wiki/Star_Wars_\(film\) "Star Wars
\(film\)")_ were rebranded as _Star Wars Legends_ and declared non-canon to
the franchise in April 2014.[4][5][6]

In the [_Star Wars_ expanded universe](/wiki/Star_Wars_expanded_universe "Star
Wars expanded universe"), Luke, following his sister's marriage to [Han
Solo](/wiki/Han_Solo "Han Solo") and the birth of the Solo children
([Anakin](/wiki/Solo_family#Anakin_Solo "Solo family"),
[Jacen](/wiki/Jacen_Solo "Jacen Solo"), and [Jaina](/wiki/Jaina_Solo "Jaina
Solo")), marries [Mara Jade](/wiki/Mara_Jade "Mara Jade"), who has a son named
[Ben](/wiki/List_of_Star_Wars_characters#S "List of Star Wars characters"). A
further complication in this continuity is the fact that the _[Return of the
Jedi](/wiki/Return_of_the_Jedi "Return of the Jedi")_ novelization includes a
detail about Owen Lars being Obi-Wan Kenobi's estranged brother.[7] To explain
subsequent references,[8] _Star Wars: Lone Wolf: A Tale of Obi-Wan and
Luke_[9] introduces "Owen Kenobi", a personification of the bond Kenobi feels
toward Owen Lars.

In the [Expanded Universe](/wiki/Expanded_Universe_\(Star_Wars\) "Expanded
Universe \(Star Wars\)") book _[Tatooine Ghost](/wiki/Tatooine_Ghost "Tatooine
Ghost")_ , Shmi's granddaughter, Leia, is given Shmi's old journal, which
describes Anakin's childhood. Leia learns, through Shmi's love for Anakin, to
forgive her father for his role in the destruction of
[Alderaan](/wiki/Alderaan "Alderaan") and for [torturing](/wiki/Torture
"Torture") her aboard the [Death Star](/wiki/Death_Star "Death Star"), as
depicted in _[A New Hope](/wiki/Star_Wars_\(film\) "Star Wars \(film\)")_.

### Ben
Skywalker[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=11
"Edit section: Ben Skywalker")]

Luke Skywalker and Mara Jade Skywalker's son. Named after Obi-Wan "Ben"
Kenobi, Jedi Knight. Former student of [Jacen Solo](/wiki/Jacen_Solo "Jacen
Solo"), his cousin. In _Fate of the Jedi: Outcast_ , he voluntarily
accompanies his father into exile. He proves himself as both a fighter and as
an investigator to carry on his father's name.

His love interest is Vestara Khai, formerly a [Sith](/wiki/Sith "Sith")
apprentice, then a Jedi apprentice.

The character was voted the 40th top _Star Wars_ character by IGN[10] and the
top 6th _Star Wars_ Expanded Universe character by UGO Networks.[11]

### Nat
Skywalker[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=12
"Edit section: Nat Skywalker")]

Nat is a former/returned Jedi master and the older brother of Kol. He took the
name **" Bantha" Rawk** He was also with him all the
time.[_[who?](/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Words_to_watch#Unsupported_attributions
"Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Words to watch")_]

### Kol
Skywalker[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=13
"Edit section: Kol Skywalker")]

Kol Skywalker is a character in _[Star Wars: Legacy](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Legacy
"Star Wars: Legacy")_. He is a descendant of Luke Skywalker and is a Jedi
master. He is the father of Cade Skywalker.

### Cade
Skywalker[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Skywalker_family&action=edit&section=14
"Edit section: Cade Skywalker")]

The descendant of [Anakin Skywalker](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker "Anakin
Skywalker"), [Luke Skywalker](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker "Luke Skywalker"), [Mara
Jade Skywalker](/wiki/Mara_Jade_Skywalker "Mara Jade Skywalker") and [Ben
Skywalker](/wiki/Ben_Skywalker "Ben Skywalker"), and the son of [Kol
Skywalker](/wiki/Kol_Skywalker "Kol Skywalker"). He is a protagonist of the
_[Star Wars: Legacy](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Legacy "Star Wars: Legacy")_ comic
series. According to the [comic book](/wiki/Comic_book "Comic book") series
from [Dark Horse](/wiki/Dark_Horse_Comics "Dark Horse Comics") called _[Star
Wars: Legacy](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Legacy "Star Wars: Legacy")_ , which takes
place 125 years after _[Return of the Jedi](/wiki/Return_of_the_Jedi "Return
of the Jedi")_ , [Cade Skywalker](/wiki/List_of_Star_Wars_characters#S "List
of Star Wars characters"), son of Kol Skywalker and a direct descendant of
Luke Skywalker, is the last surviving Skywalker of his time. It is shown that
he has completely abandoned the Jedi way after an attack by the New Sith Order
on the Jedi Academy on Ossus. Nevertheless, he still encounters other Jedi, as
well as the ghost of Luke Skywalker. The character was voted the 84th top
_Star Wars_ character by IGN.[10]
